page.title: 18ST.RONANS WELLS INNERLEITHEN
page.content: The Doo (Doves) Well on the slopes of Lee Pen was known to the local people long before its mineral waters were analysed in 1777 and Sir Walter Scott's novel St. Ronan's Well made it famous in 1834.Once it was thought that Innerleithen would become as well known as Harrogate as a Spa.Crowds flocked to drink the waters and the population rose into thousands but the Hydropathic Hotel was built in Peebles and so fame as a Spa passed us by. Visitors still take the pleasant walk up the hill,resting on seats placed so they can enjoy beautiful views over the town.The Custodian will show you the well in her garden.You can drink the mineral water in the Pavilion and sign the visitor's book.You will see that about two hundred people visit the well each year from places like U.S.A. ,Canada and Australia.
